item.title: Running as a systemd service
item.description: This guide will get you running Litestream as a systemd service on Debian-based operating systems such as Ubuntu. Running as a background service means that Litestream will always run in the background and restart automatically if the server restarts. It assumes you are comfortable with using a command line. ‚è± This should take approximately 10 minutes to complete. Prerequisites This guide assumes you have read the Getting Started tutorial already.
